article.title: Asymptotically Free Theory with Scale Invariant Thermodynamics

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the first term in Figure 1 represent?
What is the trend of the two-loop RGOPT mass using f<sup>(2L)</sup><sub>full RG</sub>, Eq. (5.15), for N = 4 as the coupling value increases?
choices: It stays real for all values of g.
It becomes complex beyond a certain coupling value.
It oscillates between real and complex values.
It decreases exponentially with increasing coupling.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which approximation method shows exact scale independence for the thermal mass at one-loop order?
Which pressure approximation exhibits the smallest scale dependence at low T/M<sub>0</sub> values?
What is the key feature of the one-loop RGOPT pressure as given by equation (5.5)?
choices: It exhibits "exact" scale invariance, neglecting higher order terms.
It depends explicitly on the coupling g.
It has a complex dependence on the temperature T.
It is identical to the standard PT pressure at one-loop order.
